file_content.text: That's it. Bomb over.
But what happened to Vaylin?
She fled like a coward. And when I catch her, I'm going to destroy her.
She escaped me, for now.
At least the Gravestone is secure.
I'm getting a signal from Theron...
The Eternal Fleet jumped to hyperspace. It's just our ships out here.
I've got reinforcements with me in the docking bay. Orders?
You wanted the Gravestone back. You've got it.
Along with you and your crew.
My people bailed out in the escape pods the minute we left the bridge. Thanks for saving them.
Stealing my ship wasn't a smart career move. They'll be branded traitors, like you.
You made them criminals.
They're only guilty of trying to help people.
I stole the Gravestone to save Zakuul. Don't ask me to apologize for it.
I don't want your apology. You betrayed me. There's no coming back from that.
[Kill Koth] Die, traitor.
Goodbye, La--
Goodbye, Koth.
This vessel is under my control.
Organic beings have a few moments to abandon ship. After that, your lives are forfeit.
Is that all I am to you?
Another "organic being" you can't wait to get rid of?
I have learned that the Gravestone, the GEMINIs, and the ships of your Eternal Fleet are all extensions of my technology. I must understand how we are connected.
Even your droid doesn't care about you, Vaylin. You're alone.
She used you, Vaylin.
You betrayed me, like all the rest.
I am unlocking hidden files and subroutines in the Gravestone that are older than the Eternal Empire. Let us keep a little perspective.
You want perspective?
SCORPIO! Where are you taking us?
The Gravestone wants to go home.
I beat her. Doesn't matter how.
It doesn't matter.
Fine, don't tell us.
Secure the bridge and don't take any chances. Alert me if you find SCORPIO or Vaylin.
Reinforcements! Hell, yeah! And we didn't blow up.
That doesn't excuse planting a bomb on my ship without telling me.
[Punch Koth]
I was gonna tell you eventually.
Thank you, Commander.
People have died so you could work out your family tree.
You've taken innocent lives.
Valkorion did something to shut her down. All she could do was run.
Valkorion sent her running.
You ever pull a stunt like this again, the Gravestone gets a new captain.
Don't go behind my back again.
Next time you play with quantum bombs, keep me in the loop.
From now on, keep me updated.
They're the reason you called for my help.
That's what you wanted me for.
I know how much they mean to you. Even after all that's happened, I still care.
I did it for you.
I drove you to it. I won't punish you for doing what you thought was right.
I forgive you anyway.
You almost sound like the Outlander I believed in.
You almost sound like the person I fell for.
A captain takes care of his crew--and I couldn't storm that bridge alone.
I wish we could've saved what we had.
They're good people. They deserve a second chance.
I'm not holding any grudges.
That's how I feel about everyone on Zakuul.
Hopefully to an escape pod. I'm not up for a second round today.
She couldn't defeat me, and she knew it.
Never mind that.
Fair enough. You can help me install the next one.
I'd like to see you try to replace me.
Okay, point taken.
Kidding.
You aren't in the clear yet, Vortena. There's a lot of making up to do.
[Flirt] You owe me a kiss.
I can manage that.
You've been after the Gravestone from the beginning.
This explains everything.
It wouldn't matter if you did. I never want to see you again, understand?
The Alliance is done with you.
Didn't think this would end with us sharing a drink.
Fine. No more secrets.
After everything you've put me through, don't expect me to let you off easy.
[Punch Koth] You owe me this.
I stole the Gravestone to save lives. I can't apologize for that.
Can't we just move on?
I guess that makes us even.
Most of those lives were lost in your war. I killed only a few myself, and it was rarely personal.
I have been seeking answers, and this vessel is one of them.
Not alone. Not yet.
Consider yourself moved.
The crisis may be averted, but my daughter still infests your ship.
You did something to Vaylin. Shut down her power...
Her aptitude with the Force made her extremely dangerous, even as a child. There was only one solution.
I conditioned her subconscious to respond to a simple phrase: "Kneel before the dragon of Zakuul."
Speak these words in Vaylin's presence, and you activate her conditioning. She will be powerless to strike you.
I've had firsthand experience with brainwashing. I wouldn't wish that fate on my worst enemy.
I know all about mind control.
I was brainwashed once, but I discovered a way to reverse the process. Vaylin may do the same.
She might break free.
Now that Vaylin knows about her conditioning, she'll do anything to break free. What are her chances?
Can she break free?
You should have told me about Vaylin's mental off-switch the second she took the throne.
No more secrets, Valkorion.
You're controlling Vaylin's mind. How could you do that to your own flesh and blood?
You brainwashed your daughter.
Your conditioning was barbaric. My daughter's was necessary.
I did not wish to cloud your mind with false hope.
If not for her conditioning, you would be dead--along with the rest of your allies.
She lacks the patience to break her mental cage.
Now Vaylin's pride is wounded, her weakness exposed. She will be more dangerous than ever.
